# Binary Logistic Regression 
binary/dichotomous dependent variable 


## Assumptions of Logistic Regression

1. Binary dependent variable fullfilling the MECE-rule
    - MECE = mutually exclusive and collectively exhaustive; meaning one case must be classified in one and only one of the two dependent categories of the binary dependent variable
2. Independent observations
3. Conditional binomial distribution
    - implies that the conditional variance is 
4. Absence of multicolinearity
5. Linear realtionship between predictors and logit
    - test the interaction effect between the predictor and the natural log of the predictor
